definition: owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: She offers up silly advice and is clueless about the latest fashion rage.
sentences.chinese: 她一无所知，老出馊主意，对流行时尚一窍不通。

sentences.english: Whose hare-brained idea was it to padlock the fire exits?
sentences.chinese: 安全门上锁是谁的馊主意？

sentences.english: We went the long way, thanks to your rotten idea.
sentences.chinese: 由于你的馊主意，我们跑了不少冤枉路。

sentences.english: Let's look at some of the most troubling ideas in detail.
sentences.chinese: 让我们详细看一下其中一些最愚蠢的馊主意。

sentences.english: But the computer company  stock he told me to buy was a lemon.
sentences.chinese: 可是这次他让我买那个电脑公司的股票却是个馊主意。

sentences.english: It’s not a bad idea to put motion detectors up there too.
sentences.chinese: 在那里装一个运动监测器肯定不会是一个馊主意。

definition: social gaffe or blunder/faux pas/see 出洋相[chu1 yang2 xiang4]
(derog.) inept advisor/a good-for-nothing adviser/one who offers bad advice
to figure out/to work out (a solution etc)/to think up/to come up with (an idea etc)
unable to accomplish anything but liable to spoil everything (idiom)/unable to do anything right/never make, but always mar
pinyin: cheng2 shi4 bu4 zu2 , bai4 shi4 you3 yu2

definition: to be lacking in moral sense/to lack common basic respect for others/lacking in virtue/mischievous/wicked/cruel/mean
